reviewText: What a powerful documentary, worth to watch.

Viktor Frankl was a human miracle.  He not only survived the Holocaust, he managed to find a lasting source of inspiration in its darkest moments--for himself, his patients, and anyone who seriously reads "Man's Search For Meaning."  Richard Dreyfus is a superb narrrator.

This is a great book for anyone, full of wisdom and stories from his time in a concentration camp.  I assign this book to my students in ethics, and they always find it worthwhile and relevant to their lives.
